content: That's not the right approach. The default is for ONE account and is used when you aren't working in other accounts. That is, if you are reading a message in account xxx and click 'new message', thunderbird assumes you want to send from your xxx account. If you're not lighting any particular message and click 'new message', then thunderbird uses default. So, the default only works when thunderbird cannot sense your preferred account. When you're in another account, it assumes that is the one to use.

I suggest starting with five suggestions: - First, be sure the menu bar is visible (File, Edit, View, Go, Messages, Events&Tasks, Tools, Help) If not shown, click alt key to show it and then click view>toolbars and tick the menu bar. Seeing that all the time simplifies finding elements of Thunderbird. - Second, experiment with view>layout to see how you prefer to display the main elements - Third, don't UNtick any features until you have some awareness of what they do, as some elements have additional menu choices - Fourth, click 'settings' and review all settings under 'General' and 'Composition' and 'Privacy&Security' - Fifth, click 'account settings' and review all options for your account MANY users ignore the fourth an fifth suggestions to their peril.

Good luck.
